title: Exercise the Buddy System | A Little Bit Better With Keri Glassman

json.text: Hey, I'm Keri Glassman, here with some quick and simple tips to help you feel just a little
bit better. It's probably been a while since you've had to use the buddy system, but if
you're one of the millions of people who want to exercise but just can't find the motivation,
the buddy system might be for you. Who wants to bail on a friend? Research shows that people
who attend group classes are more likely to exercise regularly than people who work out
alone. And it makes perfect sense. Group classes provide a structured, scheduled environment
for your workout routine. Classes are full of likeminded people who provide pressure
by proxy- you inadvertently keep each other honest by showing up regularly, even though
you may not even know each other. They start and end at a set time, prompting you to get
there, get it done and get out. Types of group classes are also so diverse these days that
you'll have the opportunity to get varied workouts in and you won't get bored. And best
of all, the presence of trained professionals to guide you helps ensure you're getting the
best workout. So remember: If you're ready to exercise but lack of motivation is getting
in your way, find a friend or try a group class. When you start feeling motivated and
excited by your workouts, you'll definitely feel a little bit better.
